get.description:
Retrieve a list of your application's bots. Response returns JSON object with info for each bot.

Returns a 401 error code for invalid app_ID or user_key.

curl -v  -X GET 'https://aiaas.pandorabots.com/bot/APP_ID?user_key=USER_KEY'

Retrieve a list of a bot's files. Returns a JSON object with each bot file associated with bot specified.

Returns a 400 error code for bot not found. Returns a 401 error code for invalid app_ID or user_key.

The return=zip option may not behave as expected using Active Docs 1.2

curl -v  -X GET 'https://aiaas.pandorabots.com/bot/APP_ID/BOTNAME?user_key=USER_KEY'

parameters.description: If set to zip, a zip file with all bot files will be returned.
parameters.name: return

get.description:
A bot personality is created by uploading AIML and other file types to Pandorabots. The files must compile correctly in order for the bot to run. By issuing a call to this API, Pandorabots will compile the bot, updating any changes that have been made to the files.

Compiling the bot makes its most recent version available for talk. A 400 error means that we were unable to compile your bot (you should check your files for syntax issues) or the botname was not found.

You can see any thrown errors in the results field of the returned JSON object:

curl -v  -X GET 'https://aiaas.pandorabots.com/bot/APP_ID/BOTNAME/verify?user_key=USER_KEY'

Retrieve pdefaults or properties bot file.

For malformed file-kind, a 404 error is returned. For invalid botname, a 400 error is returned. For unknown bot or file, a 412 error is returned.

curl -v -X GET 'https://aiaas.pandorabots.com/bot/APP_ID/BOTNAME/FILE-KIND?user_key=USER_KEY'

parameters.description: Specify the type of file being retrieved: pdefaults, properties
parameters.name: file-kind

get.description:
Retrieve an AIML, set, map or substitution bot file.

For malformed file-kind, a 404 error is returned. For invalid filename or botname, a 400 error is returned. For unknown bot or file, a 412 error is returned.

curl -v -X GET 'https://aiaas.pandorabots.com/bot/APP_ID/BOTNAME/FILE-KIND/FILENAME?user_key=USER_KEY'

parameters.description: Specify the type of file being retrieved: file (for AIML files), map, substitution, set
parameters.name: file-kind

parameters.description: Filename to retrieve. Note: for non-AIML files, do not include the file extension in the path.
parameters.name: filename

get.summary: Retrieve a bot file (AIML, set, map, substitution)

post.description:
Use these tools to test/debug/trace bot categories.

Malformed requests such as exceeding size of input or invalid clientname returns 400 error code. Error code 412 is returned if the bot is not compiled or does not exist.

curl -v  -X POST 'https://aiaas.pandorabots.com/talk/APP_ID/BOTNAME?user_key=USER_KEY&input=INPUT'

parameters.description: Message to be sent to the bot. This can contain multiple sentences. Currently the limit is 500 characters.
parameters.name: input

parameters.description: Identifies your application's end user. You can assign each of your end users a unique client_name. This will allow you to set predicates and other variable information that is specific to an individual. Format required is 3-64 characters in length and only numbers or lower-case letters [0-9][a-z]
parameters.name: client_name

parameters.description: Session ID generated by Pandorabots. This allows the application to group individual conversations into a collection. While testing your bot, not including this parameter, Pandorabots will issue a new session ID. (4-byte integer type)
parameters.name: sessionid

parameters.description: For debugging purposes, you can specify a 'that' with the input that supersedes the existing that in bot memory.
parameters.name: that

parameters.description: For debugging purposes, you can specify a 'topic' with the input that supersedes the existing topic in bot memory.
parameters.name: topic

parameters.description: Return extra conversation information. If true, input, pattern, that and topic associated with the pattern matched are returned in addition to response.
parameters.name: extra

parameters.description: Reset the bot memory. If true, all state in the bot will be discarded, and the user can talk to the bot as if it is the first time
parameters.name: reset

parameters.description: Include trace data in the response. If true, the system will generate AIML trace information for the input.
parameters.name: trace

parameters.description: If true, the system will force a reload of the bot into memory. This can be useful if you've recently uploaded an AIML file, recompiled your bot and want access to your bot's latest changes.
parameters.name: reload

parameters.description: If true, the system will not signal an error if the bot is uncompiled, and will instead look for a previous version of the bot that is available.
parameters.name: recent
